classes.cCustomCardDisplayName: ANT201, GEOG150, or Lower-Division Social Sciences Course
classes.cCustomNote:
Choose one of the following: ANT201, GEOG150, or Lower-Division Social Sciences Course.

Courses from the following disciplines will be acceptable towards the lower-division Social Sciences course: Anthropology, Ethnic Studies, Geography, Sociology, Political Science, Psychology, or Women's, Gender, and Queer Studies.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.

Any ANT/GEOG Elective (300-400 level) course can go here.

Refer to catalog for course selections.

Any Sociology Elective course can go here. 4 units must be at the 300-400 level.

Select one of the following: BUS207, BUS409, BUS410; CRP/NR404, CRP/NR408; CRP420; ES380; JOUR302; LS214; PHIL334; POLS295, POLS340, POLS342, POS384, POLS386 or POLS387, POLS417, POLS426, POLS445, POLS457; PSY375; SOC402, SOC406, SOC412.

A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may connt toward concentration requirements. Consultation with faculty advisor is recommended.
